titleStmt.title: F. C. McCalla to George W. Johnson
CWG14393

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

text.body:
<<<<<<< HEAD
J. F. Robinson, Pres't.
F. C. McCalla, Cash'r.
Office Farmers Bank of Kentucky.
Georgetown, May 25 1861
My Dear Friend--
Good news for once! Your friend Col Boyd has paid the Ballance debt-- and I feel most gloriously relieved, dont you?-- I feel so happy this morning that I have resolved to allow nothing not even War to ruffle my temper any more -- tis so much more pleasant and agreeable to be always in a good humor -- -- =======
J. F. Robinson, Pres't.
F. C. McCalla, Cash'r.
Office Farmers Bank of Kentucky.
Georgetown, May 25 1861
My Dear Friend--
Good news for once! Your friend Col Boyd has paid the Ballance debt-- and I feel most gloriously relieved, dont you?-- I feel so happy this morning that I have resolved to allow nothing not even War to ruffle my temper any more -- tis so much more pleasant and agreeable to be always in a good humor -- -- >>>>>>> c5308eddaa1ba1ff210ac9cef49899b8fe4703c8
But they would not pay any interest because the law excused them from that. -- I am so glad to get the principal that I can overlook the other without complaining. Good news isnt it?
Yours Trul
F. C. MCalla
F. C. Macalla
May 25. 1861
